name: Superigamo
description:
GMTK Jam 2020 submission, where the theme was "Out of Control".

Superigamo is heavily inspired by the 1994 DOS game, Origamo.
Credits can be viewed by pressing F1 on the menu screen.

On first startup a tutorial will run, however here are the basics:

  • Fit pieces into the various patterns using LMB to pick/place them and RMB to rotate.
  • If you place a piece while another piece of the same type is in the queue, you will lose control of the queued piece. It'll fly around into the pattern anywhere it can fit. If it can't fit anywhere it will break.
  • You can "trash" pieces on the upper garbage belt. If a piece is trashed while another of the same type is in the queue, you'll lose control of the queued piece as if you had placed one.
  • Placing pieces increases your score, while out of control pieces that place themselves subtract from it.
